com.percussion.pso.transform
Class PSOThumbnailGenerator

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSDefaultExtension
      com.percussion.extensions.general.PSFileInfo
          com.percussion.pso.transform.PSOThumbnailGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension, com.percussion.extension.IPSItemInputTransformer, com.percussion.extension.IPSRequestPreProcessor
public class PSOThumbnailGenerator
extends com.percussion.extensions.general.PSFileInfo
implements com.percussion.extension.IPSItemInputTransformer, com.percussion.extension.IPSRequestPreProcessor

Generates a fixed size thumbnail from an uploaded image.

Title: PSOThumbnailGenerator

Description: A Pre-exit that can be used on an Image Content editor to automatically generate a thumbnail for the full image.

Modernized to use the ImageIO libraries. The new libraries use biCubic interpolation for higher image quality.

This version is enhanced to handle both PSPurgableTempFile instances and Base64 encoded strings.

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2002, 2008

Company: Percussion Software

Version:
2.0
Author:
Prasad Bandaru, DavidBenua

Field Detail

log

private static org.apache.commons.logging.Log log

stepFactor

private int stepFactor
Controls the size of steps by which the image is rescaled. This value should always be a power of 2 (2,4,8...). Larger values will increase performance, but add sampling noise to the compressed image. Defaults to 2.

maxInterpolationSize

private int maxInterpolationSize
Maximum image size where interpolation is used. For images larger than this size, the image pixels are not interpolated: the "nearest pixel" algorithm is used instead. Increasing the value may increase image quality for images that are smaller than the specified size. It will also decrease performance, sometimes significantly. Defaults to 1,000,000 pixels.

Method Detail

preProcessRequest

public void preProcessRequest(Object[] params,
                              com.percussion.server.IPSRequestContext request)
                       throws com.percussion.security.PSAuthorizationException,
                              com.percussion.server.PSRequestValidationException,
                              com.percussion.extension.PSParameterMismatchException,
                              com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionProcessingException
Pre processes the current request to generate the thumbnail automatically The exit should be registered with 4 parameters.

1. SourceFieldName - Field name of the source image
2. ThumbFieldName - Field name of the thumbnail image
3. MaxDimension - Value of the Max Dimension. 4. ThumbPrefix - Prefix added to the full size image name so that the filename of the generated thumbnail is PREFIFX + FullSizeImageName 5. ThumbWidth - Specified width, overrides MaxDimension. 6. ThumbHeight - Specified height, overrides MaxDimension 7. UseOriginalFileType - If "yes", then use the same file type as the original image.

If both width and height are specified, then the image will squashed to those dimensions. If only one is specified, the aspect ratio of the original image will be used to compute the desired image size. If neither height nor width is specified, then MaxDimension will be used instead.

By default the thumbnail image is a (non-transparent) Jpeg image. If you want the thumbnail image to use the same image format as the original image, specify a "Yes" for the UseOriginalFileType parameter. The transparency and color model of the original image will be preserved, so if the original is a transparent GIF or PNG, the thumbnail will also be transparent. Of course, if the original is a JPEG, then the thumbnail will also be a JPEG.

Specified by:
preProcessRequest in interface com.percussion.extension.IPSRequestPreProcessor
Overrides:
preProcessRequest in class com.percussion.extensions.general.PSFileInfo
Parameters:
params - - parameters
request - - IPSRequestContext
Throws:

makeThumbFile

public com.percussion.util.PSPurgableTempFile makeThumbFile(InputStream imageStream,
                                                            String source_filename,
                                                            String thumb_prefix,
                                                            String parent_mimetype,
                                                            int maxDimension,
                                                            int width,
                                                            int height,
                                                            boolean useOriginalType)
Makes a thumbnail file from a byte stream.

Parameters:
imageStream - the image as a byte stream.
source_filename - the file name from the source image upload.
thumb_prefix - the prefix to be applied to the thumbnail file.
parent_mimetype - the content type of the image data. This must contain the word "image".
maxDimension - the maximum size of the thumbnail.
width - the desired width of the thumbnail.
height - the desired height of the thumbnail.
Returns:
the thumbnail as a file. Will be null if any errors occur.

createThumbnail

protected void createThumbnail(OutputStream outstream,
                               InputStream instream,
                               int maxDim,
                               int width,
                               int height,
                               boolean useOriginalType)
                        throws IOException
Reads an image in a file and creates a thumbnail in another file. Modified slightly to use ImageIO instead of Sun JPEG CODEC.

Parameters:
outstream - the thumbnail image as a byte stream. This image will always be coded as a JPEG.
instream - the source image as a byte stream.
maxDim - The width and height of the thumbnail must be maxDim pixels or less.
Throws:
IOException

paintImage

protected BufferedImage paintImage(BufferedImage inImage,
                                   int maxDim,
                                   int width,
                                   int height)
Paints a resized image onto a new buffered image. The size of the output image is determined from the original size of the image, the max dimension, height and width.

Parameters:
inImage - the input image.
maxDim - the maximum dimension. Will be the height or width depending on the aspect ratio of the input image.
width - the desired width.
height - the desired height.
Returns:
the new (resized buffered image).

computeSize

protected Dimension computeSize(int maxDim,
                                int thumbWidth,
                                int thumbHeight,
                                Dimension originalSize)
Computes the size of the thumbnail image based on parameters specified. If height and width are both specified, these values define the size directly. If only one is specified, then the aspect ration of the original image is used to find the other value. If height and width are both 0, then the maxDim parameter is used with Aspect ratio of the original image to find the thumbnail dimensions.

Parameters:
maxDim - maximum dimension
thumbWidth - desired width
thumbHeight - desired height
originalSize - size of the original image.
Returns:
the size of the thumbnail.

inImage - the original image
Returns:
the scaled image. Never null
